snippet: Some classes never met and some grades were illicitly changed in a University of North Carolina department that attracted numerous athletes, and a respected professor now faces a criminal charge.
abstract: University of North Carolina and law-enforcement officials report that some classes that attracted numerous athletes never met, and some grades in those classes were illicitly changed; indictment handed up by Orange County, NC, jury charges Prof Julius Nyang'oro, internationally respected scholar, with fraud; critics say it covers just a small piece of one of the biggest cases of academic fraud in the state's history.
lead_paragraph: Some classes never met and some grades were illicitly changed in a University of North Carolina department that attracted numerous athletes, and a respected professor now faces a criminal charge.

headline.main: A’s for Athletes, but Charges of Fraud at North Carolina
headline.print_headline: A’s for Athletes, but Charges of Tar Heel Fraud
